website_summaries.verdict: Between the Quantum Stylist’s impressive range of built-in stiches and lightning-fast performance, this model is worth a look for dedicated embroiderers.
A high-end machine that can do it all. This one is for the serious seamster who is devoted to their craft.
pros: The automatic needle threader and cutter work well and save time
It comes with an impressive number of stitches and presser feet
cons: Occasional bobbin jams can slow down progress

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved
customer_reviews.text: In my previous review I was not happy with my machine because of the thread guide. While using invisible thread it cut the guide and cut my thread every time I used it. However, I fixed the problem with a piece of a command strip. Problem solved. I have had my machine for six years and that’s the only problem I have had. I did take it in to be cleaned and serviced last year (first time) the service tech said it was a great machine. It only needed cleaning. I see a lot. I reverse my previous review and would recommend this machine. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robin AF

customer_reviews.title: Did my research this machine far exceeds the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Before deciding on a Janome take a look at this machine! It will work with the most delicate material to canvas duct! Just be sure to use the appropriate needle. I love this machine had it for a month in a half. Excellent for the money! I love the foot pedal, start stop button, automatic threader, reverse button, up down needle button and the ease of creating bobbins and threading them! Great for quilting! Has the same functionality as higher priced Janome machines but more capabilities and accessories included. Happy creating!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S.

customer_reviews.title: I finally feel better, looking forward to doing some projects
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine in 2012. I then became ill, so I never got the machine out. I finally feel better, looking forward to doing some projects. I read the booklet and started on making pillows for my daughter. I got one pillow made, three seems, and the machine quit working. All it did was beep at me. I took it to a sewing machine repair store and was told it needed a new board. Over $300 dollars. I have looked back at reviews and have seen others have received a faulty machine at this time. Is there anything that can be done??
customer_reviews.author: Susan A

customer_reviews.title: All-in-all, I'm really happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for 3 weeks so I haven't tried out everything yet. I initially had trouble with the thread cutter but I rewound the bobbin and that fixed the problem. I'm working on 2 quilts now and it sews beautifully with no trouble on different thickness. This has replaced the Brother machine I bought earlier because it heated up after sewing for a few hours. It would sew again after it "cooled down" but I didn't appreciate sewing on "Brother" time. I haven't tried all the special decorative stitches but I'll get there! It's heavier than all get out but it doesn't bounce around the table like the Brother did either. All-in-all, I'm very happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: auntiepatch

customer_reviews.title: Tension Issues - Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: Received 1st machine and noticed immediate issues with sewing tension. Bobbin thread was pulling to top resulting in an unbalanced stitch (which is not ideal for quilters or professional seamstresses as your stitch looks like a continuous straight line with no definition - please view photo for better explanation. If your stitches look like this please know it’s not normal). Feeling optimistic, I returned this machine for a replacement. The 2nd machine had that exact same issues. Spoke with Singer customer service who advised there’s no way to adjust the bobbin tension and the only resolution was to return it. Upon further research I learned that this machine is being discontinued and tension problems are very well known.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can't really even write a review as the machine will not turn on to even assess how well it works.. It turned on the first time - when I checked to see if it would - but now it just sits there, a lovely and very heavy paperweight. I have contacted both Amazon and Singer in hopes of finding a solution without having to order a replacement. After reading other reviewers' accounts of customer service for their issues, I have the feeling I will be requesting a replacement machine. I will update this review as things progress. Or don't and I return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: According to the product description I should have also received the extension table and bonus accessories. I did not. This was purchased as NEW and came out of its original box sans the extras. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: jeanette

customer_reviews.title: it sounds like a thrashing machine
customer_reviews.text: i have never had a machine that made such noise, it sounds like a thrashing machine! It sews once in awhile, but mainly something is wrong with it, the thread bunches up on the bottom, the thread breaks etc. It is something every time I try to use it. I would not have another SInger machine if they gave it to me. The nearest Singer repair is 800 miles from my location. I am so disappointed, I saved my money so I could buy this machine and now I have nothing !
customer_reviews.author: Claudia N.

customer_reviews.title: Singer Disappoints Again!
customer_reviews.text: SINGER DISAPPOINTS AGAIN! This machine worked fine for my first sowing project. Making cushions for my patio swing but that was it. Now I am trying to check bob in area for lint to see if this is the cause of thread and material getting stuck, unfortunately, the screw driver sent with machine is to tall to remove screws in face plate covering bobbing housing. As a matter of fact, even the shortest screwdriver in my house 3.5” is to tall to remove screws. Clearance from screws to Swoing machine is only two inches. Also having other problems with this machine!
customer_reviews.author: LINP

customer_reviews.title: Worthless piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I hate this machine. I have had it for 1 month and 29 days and now it will not sew. It is a weak, horrible machine that definately does not sew knits at all. Wovens are a little better, but save your money and go with something else. This machine is not worth a dime.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: My experience may not be yours, hopefully....
customer_reviews.text: This was the most amazing sewing machine ever and believe me I was ready to give a 5 star review. But it stopped working suddenly after two weeks right in the middle of an important project. I don't know why and the repair shop couldn't figure out why either. I'm hoping my refund is a success. UPDATE: my refund was fast--2 days start to finish. I ordered a different machine from the same seller as I didn't like any of the other machines from other sellers. I received the machine lightening fast. I haven't been able to use it yet. Hopefully everything will go well. I've now updated my review from one star to three.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Little

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to replace an old Singer, hoping it would be equally as durable. It has been nothing but problems from day one! It cannot handle thick fabric (dish towels, etc.) and the buttonholer is a nightmare. It is supposed to be easier and have all the "whistles and bells" but it is definitely a major cause of frustration. I would NOT recommend this machine and will be searching for a replacement. VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: Shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Defective machine
customer_reviews.text: Having problems with this machine and Amazon wont exchange because the “window” for returns has passed.... even though it’s defective. Too many issues to list here but seems to stem from the auto cutter not working properly so threads get jammed and bobbin nest twists and locks Machine. Closest Singer qualified center is 101 miles away (one way). Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: MrsWWonka

customer_reviews.title: Tension is a huge problem.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine 1 year and 3 months. I keep having trouble with the tension. I had it repaired three times but 2 months later it did it again. Now it is out of service.. It does not pick up the bobbin thread. I will not stick any more money into it..I am goint to another brand. Virginia Fletcher Yuma, Arizona
customer_reviews.author: ginniemf

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a Singer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but problems with this machine since its purchase. The feed-dogs are a constant problem. Now I can only sew at the slowest speed and even then the feed dogs will stop pulling the fabric through. I have actually not been able to use this very often due to it not working properly. I only use it when I have something that just has to be sewn. So much for and type of sewing hobby; this machine is awful. I do not know what happened to the Singer brand, but I will not buy another Singer product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it and felt like I had found the hidden ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine was outstanding for about 6 months. Loved it and felt like I had found the hidden gem of amazing machines. And then I changed my mind. After 2 trips to the repair shop- it still wasn't working. The computer never had an issue- it was the physical bobbin casing. The bobbin got stuck, would pucker, pulled at the item being sewn and would leave "blobls" of thread throughout the garmets. I'm disappointed because I loved it so much at first but am now looking for a new machine because a 3rd trip to repair the same issue within a year seems wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not a bargain at all
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked great for 31 days. Then it died. I took it to a Singer Service Center (where I was told "we see a lot of these machines in here.") They fixed it. It worked great for 10 days. Then it died again. It is still under warranty so I guess I will drive over to the service center again. But I am shopping for another machine - not a Singer this time. *Update - I reported the problem to Amazon and they are extending the return period. So while I am NOT happy with Singer, I am VERY happy with Amazon's customer service...
customer_reviews.author: HawRiverRetiree

customer_reviews.title: Get a different machine.  I have photos of its badness.
customer_reviews.text: The bobbin winder sucks on the first day. Fortunately for me I don't have to use it. I bought this because my travel machine wore out after 7 years of use and I am far from home. **upate** This machine stinks. Don't buy it. It jams and tangles and makes sewing difficult and frustrating. I'll use any other machine over this one. How is it that I have 25 machines and the only one I have trouble with is this one? I returned this one and am buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Tilly

customer_reviews.title: This machine enables my addiction for sewing
customer_reviews.text: I am new to sewing and have had this machine since December 2018. I am absolutely certain that this machine is why I am so addicted to sewing. It has sooo many options, I know I will never use them all but doing a zipper and buttons is amazingly easy which I have heard is a huge statement in sewing; even my Mom is envious, especially for the price. I love that if I do not understand something in the manual, there is info on the 'how to' on the internet. So happy with this machine I even named her.😊
customer_reviews.author: Brenda F.

customer_reviews.title: Grooved plastic part
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine in 2012 and am generally not happy with it. I find that threading the top thread needs to be repeated sometimes. If you don't get the threading just right the thread breaks as soon as you start sewing. See attached picture, the plastic part at the top of the machine where the thread begins the path to the needle deeply grooves over time and the thread breaks when it gets caught in the grooves. I will not buy another Singer. I am planning on replacing this machine with Brother or Janome.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: This arrived with an ill-fitting case that had a gap/opening underneath the wheel. Not sure that this was damaged from shipping. I can't imagine it left the factory like this. The machine was plastic and cheap. The extension table did not fit snuggly and the metal guide plate was not flush/flat to the sewing arm. I did not get to try out the machine's features as I sent it right back to Amazon and ordered a Bernina instead. You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: kaarrll

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful machine!!
customer_reviews.text: When my Janome Memory Craft 6000 could not be repaired last month I was heartsick. After 35 years, we’ve handled miles and miles of fabric together and I did not want to spend thousands of dollars again, nor re-learn a new computerized machine. Ohmysoul - this Singer 9960 machine is unbelievably wonderful: easy to use, quiet, with all of the features my old machine . . . and FAR less expensive! It even came with a hard case (I did not expect) and an extension table (which I’d spent a great deal on for my old machine). I’ve been sewing like a maniac since it arrived three days ago and I could not be more pleased!
customer_reviews.author: P. McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I would call myself an advanced beginning quilter. Needed a new sewing machine, although I didn’t realize how bad until I got a new one. Unpacked the box and started to review the manual and thought “no, I can’t keep this it’s too complicated and fancy.” Started to fill out the return form and decided to sleep on it. The next day I tried again and found out how amazing this sewing machine is and all the wonderous things it does. In sum, I recommend this sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: CocoBella85013

customer_reviews.title: I love the needle threader
customer_reviews.text: I don't think the product picture reflects this sewing machine well; it looks plastic-ish whereas in real life, it is actually well built and has some weight to it. I love the needle threader, the fact that with the click of a button you can get the bobbin thread out, the automatic thread cutter after sewing, the fact that you can choose a stitch to automatically back stitch at the beginning, etc. Definitely an upgrade from my old machine! It feels like a machine that should cost way more. I really pray it lasts long because it almost feels too good to be real. Ha! A big thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Mo'

customer_reviews.title: Started off good, ended up being a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Received it on March 27,2020 a couple days sooner than expected. Easy to set up and used. I couldn't get the needle threader to work figured what the heck I never used one before. Then today after making 6 face masks, i went to use it again the feed dogs had dropped down. I checked the setting it was in the correct position for normal sewing. I am returning it. I got a great deal for 349.00 plus shipping. Now if I want to replace it, price is 799 and some change. I dont do enough sewing to justify this price increase. Will look elsewhere for a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Clara732

customer_reviews.title: don't buy if for embroidery
customer_reviews.text: horrible machine for embroidery. could not get down even one side of small blanket without stitches messing up. thread on bobbin would jam up and tangle too. how many actually need Russian alphabet? what a waste.
customer_reviews.author: nkeyes

customer_reviews.title: Love the machine
customer_reviews.text: I have had the 9960 for 5 years, cutter was not working after about 4 years. Bought the 9985 because it was basically the same machine but with many more stitches. 3 months later the cutter does not cut, have quit using it. The backstitch button works off and on. Contacted Amazon, was told to contact Singer, waiting to hear back from them. Love the machine, hate that I keep having issues
customer_reviews.author: marty rockhold

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked great for about six months. Then the thread started getting all jammed up in the bobbin area. I cleaned it out, changed needles, changed bobbins, changed thread, to no avail. I noticed that the thread seems to have cut a groove in the top part of the case and this is causing it to fray. I looked the machine up online and found this is a common issue and a design flaw. I contacted Singer to ask about a replacement or repair and they replied that there was nothing they could do. Incredibly frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Seasoned Semstress
customer_reviews.text: I've been sewing for 10+ years now. And I've had a mechanical, computer and industrial machines. I recently moved and didn't have space to take my industrial so I was looking for something to replace my cheap brother. This thing is it. The problem I have often with computers is how light and flimsy, loud they are. This one feels solid. Its also the best price you'll find it here on amazon. I literally can't wait to sew on it.
customer_reviews.author: O'Brian

customer_reviews.title: The best sewing machine I have every owned!
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research, I chose to purchase a nice machine for myself, and I am very happy with the Singer 9960 Quantum Stylist 600-Stitch machine. his is the very best sewing machine that I have ever owned. I cannot express enough how wonderful this sewing machine is. When the machine arrived, I was sewing right away. I did watch the You Tube instructions. The automatic tension works great. I love the feet and the different stitches. I use a variety of material and all sew well with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Lyons

customer_reviews.title: In the shop
customer_reviews.text: This machine has a one year warranty on parts and labor . 5 yeas on electronics. I haven't had it 6 months and the auto thread cutter stopped working. Thank goodness it was still under warranty. When I took it into the shop they said "oh we just had one of these come in last week" and then they went on to add that it was rare to have a singer machine come in for repair. Time will tell but I am holding my breath that the thread cutter was just a fluke. Other than that, I loved the machine. I get it out of the shop in about a week so we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Butler

customer_reviews.title: Super great machine
customer_reviews.text: GREAT machine. My wife has been sewing for over 55 yrs. Purchased this machine because it does almost everything. My wife Loves it. She leans how to do something special every time she uses it. Sews about 3 days per week.
customer_reviews.author: joe d

customer_reviews.title: Good product, not for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I just got the machine for Christmas so I've not used it lots. I've played with it a little and think it will do what I wanted to do. I've been sewing for many years and figured out bobbin winding, threading & basic function. I don't think I'd recommend it for a beginner as the instructions were hard to follow. Price good for all the features.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a review from the Wife. I have now had this machine for 6 years. It still performs like new. I don't sew everyday. I don't make huge quilts, and I don't have expectations that this machine would do everything the most expensive machine out there would do. It has done anything I have needed it to do and for my level of sewing skill and project skill it has done an excellent job and has the potential to do much more than I will ever likely put it through.
customer_reviews.author: David Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new sewing machine! I do a lot of quilting, and this machine is everything I need. It has more fancy stitches than I'll ever need. In fact I'm making a Victorian crazy quilt just to use all the beautiful stitches! It is amazing. It also has the xtra large sewing base that my large quilts require. I've never had a machine with a needle threaded, but I love, love love it. Also the automatic thread cutter is a big plus for me. I read a few reviews that had me on the fence about buying it, but I'm so glad that I did. This is the best sewing machine I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Rosey

customer_reviews.title: Very good dog feed
customer_reviews.text: That machine really does the job ! It's sturd, the dog feed really "eats" the fabric, it has many stitchs and has so many needle positions to play with. It's not as quite as they make you believe, but it's ok. The space under the arm is not big enough to fit a small quilt but for regular sew, it works fine. The big downside is the alphabets: there is only one font I can really read clearly, the others are more like guessing what is written in your fabric...
customer_reviews.author: MaedoJapinha

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine so far, after two months getting to know it. Looking forward to a long and productive relationship with it! It has so many functional amped decorative stitches, sews so neatly and securely, does fine on multiple layers. It's important to use the correct needles and helpful to use the appropriate feet to get the best results on each project. There is a continuing question online about whether to use Class 15 or 15j bobbins, but I have used both with no problems. Just don't use metal ones! For the price this machine is a tremendous value.
customer_reviews.author: Knittysong

customer_reviews.title: Great machine...great price!
customer_reviews.text: What a blessing to have found this machine at Amazon for such a reasonable price. I do alterations and make dozens of totes and purses and this machine makes sewing a dream. I struggled for years with other machines but couldn't ask for anything more that this Quantum Stylist. For the money you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: So far I LOVE my new sewing machine...less expensive than other brands and so far does everything I've asked it to do. If you don't need a fancy, heavy-duty machine, I highly recommend this one. I do mostly quilting and it works great. I have a friend who has the same one and has used it for over a year and loves hers too...which is the reason I was willing to give it a try. I love all the extra feet that came with it too. The dust cover is hard plastic and slides over it with the handle sticking out for carrying and protecting from dust...protects it as you travel.
customer_reviews.author: Syl Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Good machine, not as heavy duty as the Viking, but is a good second machine.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine, so versatile and so many stitches. I had a real learning curve because I have used Viking machines for past 40+ years. I bought the machine because I was doing a quilt and needed the ability to use the lettering function. My Viking would not work, has this feature but just did not work. I had less then three weeks to complete so I ordered this machine. Performed wonderfully. Not as easy as the Viking, but then again that function was not working. Completed the quilt and then figured out what the problem was.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. It's a beautiful piece of equipment that works just like I need it to work. I've had it for about 4 months now and made garments, curtains, pillows and quilts with it. One of those quilts was queen-sized and I was able to maneuver all that fabric under the throat with little difficulty. This machine makes me want to sew something every day. Two reasons why it didn't make the 5 star cut for me: 1) Automatic needle threader broke the 4th time I used it. 2) The storage slot on the hard case is too small to hold all the extras included with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Best sewing machine ever!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING sewing machine!! I purchased this machine for less than $300 and it is BY FAR the best sewing machine I have ever owned! SO easy to learn and use. At first, I was reluctant to order it due to the computerization and the plethora of features. I figured it would be impossible to learn; however, I watched the product tutorial in this product selling link, prior to purchasing it and it looked simple enough so I made the purchase. I am delighted that it is even easier to use than what it seemed by watching the tutorial. It's very intuitively configured and an absolute dream to sew on.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: The only model I've found with adjustable pressure foot pressure, a must for sewing thin, wispy cloth for formals.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I like least that there isn't a big extension table attachment for it, I will have to buy one special made to fit it. And I will have to buy a hard carrying case for it. I'm excited and happy to have this beautiful sewing machine. It has all the features that I always thought would make the perfect sewing machine. Adjustable presser foot pressure, will solve the problem I had when I was sewing formals as a teenager. So many stitches!! A dream machine. More than one light to see where I'm sewing. I love this machine. Renay StClair
customer_reviews.author: Renay

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Sewing Machine - I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the sewing machine for anything difficult yet. However, the stitching is perfect , and the machine is easy to use. I even figured out the automatic threader. You just need to pull the lever all the way down; there are two levels. This machine was a great value as I paid less than I did when I bought my daughter a Singer, 5 years ago. This was $300 cheaper and has a lot more features.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Mom

customer_reviews.title: The Automated Features!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional seamstress and product development, small production business owner of 30 years. I own several industrial sewing machines that I use daily in my sewing shop and I was surprise how this home style machine replicated the features that I find helpful in fast production sewing amazing! I have used this machine for 2 years and have only needed to change out the little knife cutter recently. I have used it so often that the backstitch letters on the backstitch thumb button is warn off..haha I HIGHLY recomend this machine well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Miller

customer_reviews.title: I was super excited to purchase this machine
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to purchase this machine. I'm a pretty new sewer. I've been sewing for 20 years but only small projects, nothing difficult. I was excited about all the features this had for the price. Everything seems perfect and amazing except it doesn't sew straight stitches. It seems that each stitch has a tilt to it so it doesn't look straight. I debated if I should keep it since it seems like such a nice smooth sewing machine and really easy to use but I have decided that I need a straight stitch and I will be sending it back after having it for 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: catiejohn

customer_reviews.title: GREAT machine!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a quilter and have a $10k Janome MC12000 machine so you can guess I’m particular. I bought this for one of my adult daughters this Christmas. Another daughter got a well rated Brother machine for her birthday the year before. This sewing machine is WONDERFUL ... and I hate the Brother machine. . I think this little machine is excellent! I’m considering buying one for myself to take to quilting retreats and sew-alongs so I don’t have to lug my big machine everywhere. In contrast, you couldn’t pay me enough to sew on the Brother. I may have to buy my other daughter this Singer and ditch the Brother just because it’s so annoying to use. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine and easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: I have been sewing for many years but stopped for nearly 30 years! I’m retired and I wanted to start sewing again and quilting. OMG! I am in love with my machine! So fun and I am a tech geek and I am sho Jed at all the new stuff; especially the automatic threader and cutter. So cool! It takes a little while to do the auto threaded but don’t give up, it becomes very easy with practice. I’m quilting and love it!! I highly recommend this machine. I’m 68 and I’m in love!! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: customer service from singer and return issues
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to love this machine , that it would be perfect for home projets etc. from the second it arrived there has been one issue after another . I've watched every trouble shooting video on this machine every utube videos and while they have all been good the machine is still not working properly , I reached out to singer with no reply and this point I just want to return it and seem to really be struggling with getting the return info. though they say I have until the end of May to return it. :(
customer_reviews.author: kimm wakefield

customer_reviews.title: never operated a sewing machine in my life..great choice here!
customer_reviews.text: it arrived yesterday..and it was all Greek to me as they say..but after patience ..and an intuition a few video..a glance at the manual..i began sewing..i wanted this machine to just repurpose some carefully chen pieces which are no longer OUT THERE..i had saved many ..and voila..the neophyte is making my own design ..a la acquired and re-shaped..the auto-threader was a good 30 mins ..but i finessed it..and now it speaks my language..i do recommend getting a big spools of thread..so u do not have to fill the bobbin often..got my crap thread did not fill the bobbin..annoying..so get a nice sized spool
customer_reviews.author: sydrella

customer_reviews.title: Great sewing machine....
customer_reviews.text: I thought about purchasing this machine for a year and I'm glad I did. It's such a delight to sew with. I'm an intermediate sewer, so this is a step up for me. I find the instruction book functional. For more instructions, I use YouTube. I am using the different features a little at a time. Love the automatic thread cutter! I love the touch screen. So far I love everything about it, except the instruction book.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Nice sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I like this sewing machine except for a couple of minor things. I do not use the automatic needle threader, and it is in the way for manual threading. Also, I do not expect to ever use the start/stop button, but it is in a prime spot on the machine. That location would be much better used for the reverse, which I use frequently. One of the things I like about it is it sews stretch fabric without puckering.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Machine I received was not working . I was so disappointed. Good thing was Amazon made it very easy to return.
customer_reviews.author: Sabine Dainczyk

customer_reviews.title: Singer makes a great sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sewing machine to replace a Singer Quantum I had gotten rid of several years ago. Quality is still the same as Singer has always provided. This sewing machine is heavy enough it doesn’t bounce around when I’m sewing with a little speed. This is an easy sewing machine to operate and there is a thirty minute (or so) instructional video that walks you through the general features of the machine. I’m an experienced seamstress and will mostly be using this for quilting and crafts. I’m really happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Karen in Denver

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I'll wanted to wait a few mon th hs before reviewing this so I could see how it worked. I love this machine. Honestly the chances of me using all these stitches are pretty remote but you never know! I have used many of them. This machine, slowly mind you, sewed through 5 layers of denim. I have also sewn 2 layers of glove leather. It is a good sewing machine. Use common sense with it. You can go 90 to nothing through several layers of duck cloth, but it WILL sew them. For general sewing it has a great speed and "feel" to it. Its really too big to take anywhere but I do it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Monique J.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This machine constantly breaking thread. The needle mechanism is faulty as it doesn't work with any of the presser feet it came with. The needles are constantly breaking off because they are over casting to the front of the foot. Straight out of the box the automatic needle threader didn't work. Just overall dissatisfied with this machine
customer_reviews.author: Kati

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to write a review for this sewing machine, my fiancée wanted to learn sewing so I decided to get her this one, plugged it and nothing, called singer and they told us the motherboard is defected and that they won’t be able to fix it. It’s been sitting in it’s box for the past year
customer_reviews.author: Levon H

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner quilter and I love this machine. It is a fun machine to work on. Down side is I bought it online so nobody to teach me to use it. Other down side is it is difficult to fit a quilt though the opening. I did quilt a lap size quilt on it though and it came out great! Would recommend to new sewers/quilters to buy your machine from a store so they will help you learn to use it.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first...
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced sewer. Worked great at first. I have kept it clean and maintained. Looks like I am having the same trouble that numerous other people are reporting. The thread jams when sewing, then after the top thread wont pull up the bobbin thread anymore. Piece of garbage. Will never buy another Singer. Used to love them. Now am switching to Bernina.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Evanson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It is an ok product. I think it has some issues though. Winding your bobbin is a little difficult because the thread doesn't stay where it is suppose to which makes the bobbin wind one sided. I have been using this machine for about 10 months and it is starting to make a banging noise when I sew with it. I will have to see why later. The bobbins it comes with is different than the ones they want you to purchase if you need more. But I did give it a 5 star rating because it is a good machine and does many things. and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Mckeague

customer_reviews.title: Happy in Clinton, TN with the Singer 9960.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 47 year old sewing machine with the Singer 9960. After researching sewing machines, I decided on the singer 9960; the main reason is because it has a metal frame and all the features I wanted. I love it; it is quiet, and the stitching is so precise and so many selections. I highly recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Boggs

customer_reviews.title: We've had the machine for only 3 days and the ...
customer_reviews.text: We've had the machine for only 3 days and the thread cutter stopped working. Opened up bobbin case, etc, tried cleaning it, thread cutter still doesn't work. Expensive machine that breaks in 3 days flat.
customer_reviews.author: Power Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine. Lots of stitches, and it's also very quiet compared to my other machine. I have had it now for 2 mos and have used it almost daily for quilting projects. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi F.

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: My wife learned how to operate this sewing machine very quickly. Once it was out of the box, the directions provided all she needed to start putting the finishing touches on projects she had started. She loves this machine, and has been very happy that it performs all the tasks she needed. My wife was somewhat knowledgeable in using a sewing machine, but this new machne provides her numerous stitches that she's anxious to experiment with and learn! I would highly recommend this machine to anyone considering its purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This machine is awesome. Lots of bells and whistles. If you are a novice, would not recommend. If you're an experienced seamstress, please take the time to read instructions. Lots of gadgets...learn it...don't break it. A lot of the negative comments I read were probably caused by people not learning everything first. Sews beautifully and once you familiarize yourself with it...easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This can't be a new machine
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for 8 days. There doesn't seem to be a decent tension on it. The underneath thread jams up and the needle that came with it had a bur on it that cut the thread. The needle threader fell off. The instruction book is hard to read. I have had to go to utube video's to make some sense of it. How long have I got to return it?. I was even charged shipping and handling when the website said it was free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Model discontinued because so many problems BUYER BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to treat myself to a nice machine. I spent a lot of money only through extensive research to find out that this model was discontinued by Singer because of all the problems. The instruction manual is awful! I watched "you tube" to try to get the machine to work. I have spent hours trying to use it with no luck. I am an experienced seamstress so not a novice sewing for the first time. So disappointed that I am stuck with this lemon that doesn't work! I have always bought Singer because they were invented where I grew up and felt like Singer was to sewing like hotdogs are to baseball. I am totally disgusted on this situation!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Making quilts and purses!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love this sewing machine. So happy that I purchased it. Much cheaper on Amazon than in the store. If you are thinking about buying it just do it you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Tonka

customer_reviews.title: Happier sewing!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't sewn much on it but the embroidery options are easy to play with/use. Earlier review said to read the manual before starting....I did and that helped. I like the weight of the machine...not too much to haul around but sturdy and won't jitter all over the table when "speeding" like my old one. Love the deeper throat for bulky projects. Very pleased with this purchase! Updated one year later: STILL loving this machine. Very happy with it and glad I upgraded! My mom was impressed enough that she just ordered one to replace her Brother "retreat" aka traveling machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Go Singer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife on our wedding anniversary after reading many reviews on Amazon. Singer has been here for ages. My mother used to used one when we were growing up. Those were bulky and came with leg peddle. My first impression on the new Singer - A Great looking machine- compact, sleek, portable, digital and full of features. But we are still exploring. Delivery was on time and the machine came well packaged. For novice user, it would have been nice if the package included video instructions (CD/DVD) rather than manual. Thought I heard that videos were available on YouTube. A very steep learning curve before we can explore all its features.
customer_reviews.author: vindhan

customer_reviews.title: Great for manogramming and can be used for canvas/ leather
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Xmas in 2017 after we had a flood in our basement and was worried that her old machine wouldn’t work any longer. I’ve been the actual main user of it since as a complete amateur using YouTube as my instructor for everything from threading a bobbin to actually using the machine. This thing is fantastic! I bought heavier needles because I’ve been sewing waxed canvas together to create covers for many of out outdoor tools like axes that we use in the field that have to carried distances. It works as expected and being able to stitch in a monogram or a phrase /name on a case takes this to another level.
customer_reviews.author: Jim & Valerie Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my old Kenmore of 30 years once I started quilting and needed more feet. It’s been a great machine for the money with lots of videos online on how to use it and all 25 feet. I’m not sure you can find a better machine for the price. I would highly recommend for the budget minded. I considered many machines under $750 and have been happy with my choice after sewing 5 quilts with it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky P

customer_reviews.title: Foot controller quit working. Used 2 times!
customer_reviews.text: Rating this machine a 3 only because I have used it 2 times since receiving it. I use it one day and work fine. Used it the next day and foot controller quit working. Hoping I didn't make a mistake buying this machine. Really hope it is only the pedal and not the connection component.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bobbin case
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the 4 1/2 star rating fool you! I bought this machine 9960 in July 2017. It worked fine until last week (5-3-17). The bobbin case started knotting up and locking up the needle. I bought it because my niece had one and loved it. Called the Singer 800# and they said since it's not the machine head or parts it isn't covered on the warranty. I can take it 1 hour away to the nearest Singer repair service. They will pay for the parts but not the labor. Regretting buying this machine that I was told by another repair shop is not made by Singer anymore. The name was bought by a foreign country.
customer_reviews.author: T jaramillo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice machine for heavy duty sewing
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a spare machine for heavy duty vinyl and double layer sewing. I tried a few brand machines and this one is by far my favorite. The needle down feature allows quicker corner sewing. It's a nice hardy machine that sewed thru my vinyl and double layers of rubber easily. Even did velcro with ease. Really impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: S. thomas

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! RunAWAY
customer_reviews.text: Has had tension issues since I got it. This machine makes projects more difficult always having to start over because the thread is jumbled or got ripped. More trouble than anything I have ever used. Now costing 1/2 of it to get fixed. Terrible product and most sewing companies will not touch this machine since they can't gurantee their work. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: matt o'daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners! This is my first time sewing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first sewing machine and I am so impressed at how easy it is to use. I choose the stitch that I need and it tells me which pressure foot I need to use. Also if I am missing a step, it shows me on the screen what I need to do. I am learning and so this is very helpful. The machine runs smoothly and to the speed I need while learning. If needed I can always increase the speed. I threaded the machine for the first time using the instructions and continue to sew without a problem. Highly recommended! I love my Quantum Stylist 9985!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess HybridRose

customer_reviews.title: A tale of two machines
customer_reviews.text: Bought the refurbished one and regretted it for the 2 months before it died. To their credit, Singer sent me a new one, which works brilliantly.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT Happy! This sewing machine was great in the beginning but after a while I started running into some issues. Keep in mind that I only had this thing for TWO weeks. I received this on July 5th! It's a quite machine and all but the features are laughable. It Keeps jamming on me, I found white goop inside the machine (don't think that's normal) and the start and stop button does not work. Its ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This machine is not as it appears to be! Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when my machine arrived. As I began the learning process with this new item, I thought I was doing something wrong because it wasn't operating as I thought it should. I finally had to take it yo a repair shop for repairs. I found out that the thread cutter slips out of place easily. Now, I have a machine that I cannot use all of the features that it has. if I do use the cutter it then keeps cutting the bobbin thread, then I cannot sew at all. I would never suggest someone to purchase this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Winona Mixen

customer_reviews.title: Way beyond me.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the directions, watched all the videos, payed close attention, and still I couldn’t run this machine! I’m not new to sewing but this one is definitely NOT for the novice seamstress. It may deserve a higher overall rating but this is what I feel it deserves from a non-expert seamstress. I gave it my all over four days and I couldn’t feel successful or comfortable or competent. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: It really does eat your material.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this machine since March. At first it was amazing and now it’s just “meh” it’s eating my material. I saw this in one of the reviews before I purchased it and disregarded the review. This machine eats the material not sure why but it does. I move the thread from the feeding plate and it still eats my material. I will call for support but I’m sure I’m gonna have to send the machine in and that’s not gonna be good.
customer_reviews.author: dw

customer_reviews.title: Easy Bobbin load
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say Awesome sewing machine! I purchased this machine October 2014. I have had it for over 2 years, not one single issue. I have sewn many quilts, baby blankets, bibs, cloths, curtains... what I love about this machine, the easy bobbin loading!! This is the 6 th machine I have owned over the years. I even purchased one for my sister. There are so many different stitches to chose from. Easy very easy to sew with.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Cross

customer_reviews.title: Stay far away from this machine
customer_reviews.text: I loved this machine the first 1.5 months. Then the thread cutter broke and the thread forms a huge knot on the underside of the fabric. It ruined a quilt I was putting the finishing stitches on. Since it is only warrantied for 30 days through Amazon, I have to pay shipping back to Singer for them to fix it instead of replacing it. The feed dogs don't raise high enough to sew thin fabric so the fabric either gets stuck in the pressure plate and has to be cut out or you have to pull the fabric as you're sewing to it through the machine. Absolute piece of trash machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with my new Singer Quantum Stylist 9960!!! I'm 70 years old and was concerned about the learning curve of a new, modern machine but I've been able to figure each thing out with the instruction manual and tutorials on the internet. I haven't had one problem with it, and it's a workhorse of a machine! It was shipped quickly and arrived right on time. I am one very happy customer! THANKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: R S Nuss

customer_reviews.title: Nice at first
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice little machine at first, but after about two months into it the tension no longer wanted to adjust appropriately and I’ve spent more time manually adjusting than getting to sew. Not happy. I was hoping this machine would make it atleast a year, but at this rate we will be lucky to make it a few more months.
customer_reviews.author: TifBer14

customer_reviews.title: Don't Purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine stopped working properly after a week so I returned it. I upgraded to a much better machine. I recommend purchasing a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, but like all Singer machines
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, but like all Singer machines, there is service. In Raleigh, there is one authorized repair dealer who services 4 states. Based on some of his comments I doubt if they will continue much longer. Also so many other repair places refuse to work on the computerized machines. Most of their techs are old school..
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie S Bleiweiss

customer_reviews.title: the man told my son not to buy another Singer machine due to poor quality nowadays with the company
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't even give it one star. It was inferior from the start. My son in law took it to a Singer Sewing and repair store and was told not to even try to have it repaired. there was another machine in the store waiting to be repaired, it had been waiting on parts for two months. the man told my son not to buy another Singer machine due to poor quality nowadays with the company. My granddaughter has had problems with it since she opened it two weeks after Christmas. It is pretty bad when I order the first time from Amazon and I receive a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low cost but isn't reliable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sewing machine a few years back. I used it here and there but not super regularly. It did have issues with jamming and the cut thread feature stopped working fairly soon after I bought it. It currently has a broken circuit board. It just stopped working one day so I took it to a shop. It'll cost me over 200 to get it replaced which is almost the cost of the machine itself. I got a few good years out of it, but a sewing machine is something that you want to last significantly longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Singer, just as good as it's always been.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have several machines, including a longarm quilter. I have a singer ce 250 embroidery/sewing machine, that I really like, but it just didn't do everything I wanted. This fit the bill. All those stitches (which I will probably never use all of them), but they're there if I want to. I like the fact that you can move the needle as desired. I make pillows with cording and u can a just the needle to go a little closer to the cord with every seam. It really makes for nice looking decor pillows. I'll need to school myself on all the functions, but that's the fun part...figuring out what does what. Singer, always a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Poore

customer_reviews.title: Horrible from day 1
customer_reviews.text: Worst machine I've ever had. Temperamental , and auto thread cutter broke within weeks costing 180 to repair. Computerized buttons are screwed up and do not do what the button indicates. Save you money and get a different machine.
customer_reviews.author: chefblueeyes

customer_reviews.title: High End Features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife's Christmas present. She loves to sew and her old machine was finally beyond repair. She loves the features and the power of the QS 9985. Already, she has recovered all our pillows in the house. She is about to start recovering all the cushions in the camper. At first the technology was intimidating. But she is learning to enjoy all the fancy gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cox

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sewing machine!,,
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond happy with my 9960! The display and stitch selection is so easy to use and just amazing how easy and quick it is to switch stitches. I am completely in love with this sewing machine! I watched most of roxannesews tutorials on YouTube and she explained everything perfectly I am having so much fun sewing all kinds of things! It did eat some fabric last night and the screws are impossible to unscrew to get the top open with the screwdriver it gives you . getting a shorter screwdriver will be the simple fix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After just four uses and a month of the purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: After just four uses and a month of the purchase, the machines automatic thread cutter causes the thread to jam, stacking the pieces of clothe I sew onto the needle plate. I can return it and Singer Costumer Service takes forever to contact you back. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Seller and Costumer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and price point
customer_reviews.text: Is a very comprehensive machine. Definitely for more advanced sewers; I would recommend going with a less expensive version if you are a beginner. Otherwise you will never use all of the attachments and options. Love the multi fonts for monogramming; extremely easy to navigate the hundreds of stitches. Comes with multiple feet and extension table which will be great for quilting as well. Love Singer-my last machine was over 50 years old and still worked just fine. I really just wanted electronic controls and this one fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Good sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Having never sewn on a machine before, I found the threading part rather complicated. But once you get over that hump it is easy and fun to use. I use it on a fairly regular basis, have had it for over a year now and have not had any problems with it. They lost one star for the instructions -- it needs to be rewritten so that it is easier to understand and follow. I'll be glad to help if you would like.
customer_reviews.author: ABeautifulLife

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Does not do what it says it can do. Deceptive in my eyes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs service in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this machine. The 2’dnstylist I have bought and it’s already giving me headaches. The first one was amazing and I bought this machine on April 11, 2020 and it continues to give me a rethread, tension error. I have done everything possible shy of paying for a service fee close to $100. I should not have this issue in less than 6 months of owning it. Wish I could return it but I guess I’m stuck with having to pay for service on a less than 6 month old machine.
customer_reviews.author: Star Klein

customer_reviews.title: It has a tricky threader that will have you pulling your hair out,
customer_reviews.text: My problem, it’s gonna sound like a “so what” is the needle threader Oh I know how to do it, and once in 20 tries.,I will get it, It frustrates me because I don’t want to interrupt a project and try to thread the dang thing for 10 minutes, I am going to return it and get a Brother. They have a great auto threader and has many of the same bells and whistles
customer_reviews.author: Brightin Browning

product_meta.title: SINGER | Quantum Stylist 9960 Computerized Portable Sewing Machine with 600-Stitches Electronic Auto Pilot Mode, Extension Table and Bonus Accessories, Perfect for Customizing Projects
product_meta.description: Style Name:9960 Sewing Machine"The SINGER Quantum Stylist 9960 sewing machine has loads of ease-of-use features to allow you to fulfill your creative dreams. Its 600 Built-In Stitches include 5 Alphanumeric Fonts and 13 Fully Automatic 1-Step Buttonholes with Exclusive Buttonhole Underplate, Mirror Imaging, and Stitch Elongation options provide even more creative possibilities. Start-up is a breeze with quick and easy threading, preset stitch length and width, built-in needle threader, built-in thread cutter, stitch editing capabilities, a start/stop button and direct button stitch selection. Packed with features, this machine truly has it all. The computerized sewing machine with large LCD screen, provides clear and easy viewing of stitch functions including stitch length, stitch width, tension settings, recommended presser foot, needle up/down position and more! The SINGER Quantum Stylist 9960 sewing machine includes an extension table providing a larger working area, essential for quilting or when working with larger projects. It has 2 StayBright LED lights which illuminate the sewing surface for optimal viewing. This sewing machine has a ton of other features like electronic twin needle settings, 7-segment feeding system, automatic locking stitch function, built-in reverse, horizontal threading, automatic bobbin winding clutch, direct select stitch selection buttons, automatic tension settings, extra-high presser foot lift, center zigzag taper, automatic presser foot pressure control and optimum power control. PRODUCT DETAILS: Model Number - 9960 Description - 600 Stitch Electronic Sewing Machine Product - Sewing Machine Bobbin Class - 15 Transparent Needles - 2020 & 2045 Lightbulb - LED UPC - 037431884411 Dimensions - 17""L x 8.25""W x 12""H Weight – 18.2 pounds Warranty - 25-Year Limited". Watts:55,Volts:120V,Amps:0.46,Hertz:60
feature_bullets: SINGER COMPUTERIZED SEWING MACHINE: The SINGER Quantum Stylist 9960 portable sewing machine has loads of ease-of-use features to allow you to fulfill your creative dreams Has a large selection of stitches including basic, stretch and decorative stitches for fashion sewing, quilting, home decor and crafting There’s even a selection of fonts to personalize projects

AUTOMATIC NEEDLE THREADER: Threading the machine is so easy that you can have the entire machine threaded, from the spool to the needle’s eye, in seconds The built-in needle threader threads the eye of the needle for you, eliminating eye strain and frustration

BEST SEWING MACHINE: The SINGER Quantum Stylist 9960 sewing machine has 600 Built-In Stitches including 5 Alphanumeric Fonts and 13 built-in 1-Step Buttonholes with Exclusive Buttonhole Underplate It also has Mirror Imaging and Stitch Elongation providing even more creative possibilities
HIGH-SPEED SEWING MACHINE: The SINGER Quantum Stylist 9960 sewing machine has a maximum sewing speed of 850 stitches-per-minute, projects can be sewn quickly

SEWING MACHINE ACCESSORIES: A variety of presser feet are included with the sewing machine: All-Purpose Foot, Zipper Foot, Buttonhole Foot with Underplate, Button Sewing Foot, Blind Hem Foot, Satin Stitch Foot, Open Toe Foot, Overcasting Foot, Darning and Embroidery Foot, Rolled Hem Foot, Cording Foot, Straight Stitch/Quilting Foot, Even Feed / Walking Foot 110 volt machine designed for United States and Canadian use only

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,564 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: The singer 9960 quantum stylist sewing machine has a limited 25-year warranty including 5-year on electronic components and 1-year on labor.
specifications.Included Components: Included Accessories: Extra Wide Extension Table, Pack of Needles, Bobbins
